page.title: 19TOURISM IN CURY/GUNWALLOE
page.content: The area is a popular tourist attraction with its fine beaches, coastal footpath, & pleasurable walks with contrasting scenery. There are sandy beaches at Gunwalloe Church Cove and Halzephron Cove and a more pebbbly beach stretching from Gunwalloe Fishing Cove to Porthleven.The coastal footpath passes through the area with its ever changing scenery and is very popular with tourists. The area contains some enjoyable country walks or, for those who enjoy riding, some quiet pony trails. It is a very quiet relaxing area for visitors to enjoy. The area contains some holiday homes and Bed and Breakfast accommodation. Surrounding areas contain Caravan and Holiday Camp Sites. Some of the coastal areas are under the jurisdiction of the National Trust.
